content:
• Friday, November 30, 2018
  • VIEMF

    ARCO, SRT, CIG and AM among after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: OTCPK:VIEMF +31.34%. ARCO +6.55%. SRT +5.77%. AAC +5.58%. BSM +4.18%.
    • Top Losers: CIG -4.95%. BLCM -4.73%. AM -4.01%. HOME 4%. HTHT -3.99%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • DSS

    DSS terminates GEMM deal

    • Document Security Systems (NYSEMKT:DSS) announces that it conducted a due diligence report and decided to terminate the purchase agreement with GEMM.
    • DSS initially offered to pay $4.5M in cash and stock to acquire a 51% stake in GEMM from owner Li Kin Pong.
    • DSS shares are up 1% aftermarket to $0.98.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • RSYS

    Radisys +6% on CFIUS merger approval

    • Radisys (NASDAQ:RSYS) announces that the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) cleared the planned acquisition of the company by Reliance Industries.
    • CFIUS clearance was the last governmental hurdle for the deal and the companies plan to merge on December 7. After that, Radisys shareholders receive $1.72 in cash per share and the RSYS ticker will be delisted from the Nasdaq.
    • Radisys shares are up 6.2% aftermarket to $1.71.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 8 Comments
  • AKTS

    Lake Street starts Akoustis at 100% upside

    • Lake Street starts Akoustis Technology (NASDAQ:AKTS) with a Buy rating and a $10 price target.
    • The firm thinks AKTS's differentiated products can help it gain share in the $5.4B bulk acoustic wave RF filter market.
    • Lake Street is looking for these bulk acoustic wave filter drivers: 5G-driven frequency band expansion, backward compatibility requirements, and seamless cellular/Wi-Fi switching.
    • The firm thinks a 1% share of the 2021 SAM will translate to revenue of ~$54M.
    • Source: Briefing.com.
    • AKTS closed today up 1.6% to $5.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • VIA

    Viacom faces new tests as AT&T starts leveraging Warner content

    • The increasingly apparent weaponization of Time Warner by AT&T is just the latest industry catalyst to put pressure on struggling Viacom (VIA -3.5%, VIAB -3.5%), Bloomberg notes.
    • Distributors like Viacom and CBS (CBS -2.1%) will feel additional heat the more that content/distribution giants like AT&T emphasize their own content.
    • Not helping: a disappointing showing for the Mark Wahlberg film Instant Family, after Paramount Pictures was a bright spot in Viacom's last quarterly earnings. The film hit $35.6M in cumulative domestic grosses last weekend, its second in release, with no foreign showings.
    • That showing led Imperial Capital to cut fiscal Q1 earnings estimates, according to the report. "Although management has referenced it on numerous occasions, we have yet to see evidence of a true turnaround at Paramount," writes the firm's David Miller.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 10 Comments
  • SMAR

    Smartsheet +2.6% on target boost ahead of earnings

    • RBC Capital maintains an Outperform rating on Smartsheet (NYSE:SMAR) and drops the price target by $5 to $34.
    • Smartsheet will report earnings after the market closes on Monday. Analysts expect $44.12M in revenue and 0.16 loss per share.
    • Smartsheet shares are up 2.6% to $26.87.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • BKD

    Investor Litt urges split of Brookdale into REIT and senior housing operator; shares up 2%

    • Bloomberg reports that activist Jonathan Litt is proposing that Brookdale Senior Living (BKD +1.9%) be split into a real estate investment trust (REIT) and an operator of senior housing.
    • In a conference call two days ago with Chairman Lee Wielansky and CEO Cindy Baier, he said that moving the company's best properties into a REIT would unlock significant value.
    • BKD operates almost 1,000 facilities in 46 states. Shares are currently exchanging hands at $8.50, a modest 1.8 price/book ratio. Competitor Capital Senior Living (CSU -2.8%), for example, currently trades at 4.5x book.
    • Previously: Brookdale Senior Living up 2% on plan from activist investor (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • ATVI

    Videogame sales rise 24% in Q3 summary look

    • A Q3 wrap-up of videogame sales showed consumer spending in the sector rose 24% Y/Y, hitting $9.1B overall.
    • That's the July-September period before the key holiday release season, which kicked off with a bang last month via a record October spurred by new Call of Duty (ATVI -6.1%) and Red Dead Redemption 2 (TTWO -2.5%) releases.
    • Videogame content sales were up 25% to $7.9B, NPD Group says, with broad gains led by mobile games and digital content for consoles/portables.
    • Hardware sales were up 11% for the quarter, to $737M, while accessory sales rose 44% with all-time quarterly records in headsets as well as in game cards.
    • The software releases with the biggest quarterly impact on dollar sales, according to NPD Group? Alphabetically: Candy Crush Saga (NASDAQ:ATVI), Fortnite (Epic, 40% owned by OTCPK:TCEHY), Madden NFL 19 (EA -2.9%), Marvel's Spider-Man (SNE +1.9%) and NBA 2K19 (NASDAQ:TTWO).
    • Weighing on industry shares today is a dim forecast from GameStop, which projects holiday sales skewing toward hardware from software.
    • Industry tickers: MSFT +0.2%, OTCPK:NTDOY -1.6%, HEAR -5.2%, OTCPK:UBSFY +1.7%, OTC:NCBDY, OTCPK:CCOEY -5.1%, GME -6.4%.
    • ETFs: GAMR -0.7%, ESPO -0.6%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 57 Comments
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs -2.5% after BAML adds to stack of downgrades

    • Goldman Sachs (GS -2.5%) is the day's worst Dow performer as BofA Merrill Lynch downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy with a $225 price target, slashed from $280, citing the uncertainty around the 1MDB investigation.
    • While GS’s decline means the shares already are discounting “most of the potential negative scenarios” related to the issue, limited information means that more bad news could emerge, with lingering uncertainty ahead at the least, writes BAML analyst Michael Carrier.
    • GS “could face fines, penalties and other sanctions, but as of now, we don’t expect it to have a long-term impact on the business,” Carrier writes, but he does not see the stock moving forward without more clarity on the consequences.
    • Carrier is enthusiastic over the longer term about GS's growth initiatives, cost controls and new management team; looking at past cases, Carrier thinks GS could face as much as a $2B penalty at the high end, “so it appears to us that the stock has more than discounted the outcome.”
    • Morgan Stanley downgraded GS last week, also citing uncertainty over the 1MDB scandal.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 10 Comments
  • FOX

    An AT&T Hulu stake sale could bring $930M

    • As it mentioned during an analyst meeting yesterday, AT&T (T +1.5%) is mulling a sale of the 10% of Hulu that it got as part of its takeover of Time Warner.
    • That's a stake valued up to $930M, a move that would help the company shed heavy debt that it acquired as part of its $85B acquisition. It would also clear a piece that's become nonstrategic, as AT&T plans its own three-tiered approach to a WarnerMedia streaming service that would square off against Netflix.
    • That valuation is based on Disney's (DIS -1%) most recent numbers valuing Hulu at $9.296B after Disney closes on media assets of Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX -0.2%, FOXA). That transaction means Disney would add Fox's 30% ownership in Hulu to its own 30%, leaving just Comcast (CMCSA -1.1%) as a 30% stakeholder -- and Disney would be tempted to try to buy out Comcast as well.
    • And $930M would mark a 16% premium over Time Warner's $583M investment in August 2016 plus $200M capital contributions.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 52 Comments
  • BRQS

    AMBA, WDAY and VSLR among notable tech movers

    • Gainers: Borqs Technologies (NASDAQ:BRQS) +115%. Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) +19%. iCAD (NASDAQ:ICAD) +14%. Workday (NYSE:WDAY) +14%. Huami Corporation (NYSE:HMI) +11%.
    • Losers: Vivint Solar (NYSE:VSLR) -22%. Yext (NYSE:YEXT) -20%. NantHealth (NASDAQ:NH) -12%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) -12%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • UAL

    WSJ: United nears deal on Avianca loan, partnership

    • United Continental (UAL +1.1%) is in the final stages of sealing a deal to partner with Latin American carrier Avianca (AVH +7.6%) by agreeing to an unusual arrangement to pay off debt owed to a hedge fund, WSJ reports.
    • UAL in effect would lend money to German Efromovich who owns just over half of AVH, the funds would be used to repay a loan from Elliott Management, and the AVH shares controlled by Efromovich would be put up as collateral for the loan, according to the report.
    • As part of the deal, the airlines reportedly would form a three-way joint business agreement with Panama-based Copa Holdings (CPA +0.8%) to integrate service and coordinate pricing and schedules on their networks between the U.S. and Latin America.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • EQGP

    EQGP Holdings and Centrus Energy among Energy/Material gainers; Jones Energy and EP Energy among losers

    • Gainers: EQGP Holdings (NYSE:EQGP) +18%. Centrus Energy (NYSEMKT:LEU) +9%. Trecora Resources (NYSE:TREC) +7%.
    • Losers: Jones Energy (OTC:JONE) -19%. EP Energy (NYSE:EPE) -10%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) -9%. Extraction Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:XOG) -8%. Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 1 Comment

  • Markets head higher on trade chatter

    • The algos have sensed something positive in all the trade chatter from emanating form Buenos Aires in the past few minutes, sending the S&P 500 from flat to up 0.4%. Now back to your regularly scheduled day.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 27 Comments
  • TOL

    Toll Brothers bull trims estimate; shares down 2%

    • RBC's Mike Dahl expects Toll Brothers (TOL -2%) won't be immune from the broad weakness in the housing market. He cuts his forecast for order growth in fiscal 2019 to up 3.5% from 5% previously.
    • Toll, he says, might have somewhat better visibility than peers thanks to a longer backlog.
    • He continues to rate the stock at Outperform.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • TVPT

    Travelport Worldwide jumps on M&A chatter

    • Shares of Travelport Worldwide (NYSE:TVPT) jump in midday trading after a new round of M&A chatter circulates around trading desks. TVPT was up 5.0%, but has backtracked to a 2.5% gain.
    • Travelport is at a multi-week high.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • NXTM

    NxStage Medical down 6%

    • NxStage Medical (NXTM -6.3%) is down on more than double normal volume. No readily discernible news accounts for the action. The key looming event is the pending consummation of its merger with Fresenius Medical Care (FMS -1.6%).
    • Previously: NxStage Medical under modest pressure on slow pace of acquirer Fresenius to work through U.S. antitrust issues; shares down a fraction (Dec. 14, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • SITC

    SITE Centers leads financial gainers; PagSeguro Digital leads losers

    • Gainers: SITE Centers (NYSE:SITC) +6%. Safeguard Scientifics (NYSE:SFE) +6%.
    • Losers: PagSeguro Digital (NYSE:PAGS) -12%. Yintech Investment Holdings (NASDAQ:YIN) -7%. Marine Petroleum Trust (NASDAQ:MARPS) -6%. China Internet Nationwide Financial Services (NASDAQ:CIFS) -6%. U.S. Global Investors (NASDAQ:GROW) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • NTEC

    Intec Pharma up 9%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Intec Pharma (NTEC +9.1%) is up more than a 5x surge in volume. Shares were up over 27% before retracing.
    • The action appears to be related to a bullish call from noted investor Marc Cohodes (who usually shorts), made during his Periscope broadcast.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • SBGI

    Tribune Media +1.6% on report buyout could bring $43/share

    • Tribune Media (TRCO +1.6%) is getting a bit of a midday lift with the New York Post reporting it's set to draw more than $43/share from a number of buyout bidders.
    • That's the price Tribune was set to get from Sinclair Broadcast Group (NASDAQ:SBGI) before regulators put a kibosh on that proposed deal. TRCO is currently at $40.51/share.
    • Nexstar Media Group (NXST +0.6%) is in the lead, according to the report, amid a once-crowded field that also includes a team of Apollo (APO -1.7%) and Northwest Broadcasting, and other bidders including Tegna (TGNA -2%).
    • The bloc of ION Media, Tom Hicks and Cerberus has dropped out, according to the report, as has Byron Allen after he failed to line up backers.
    • Nexstar (owner of some 171 stations) could present its own regulatory risk to the deal, however; the combo would unseat Sinclair as the biggest local station owner in the country.
    • Previously: Tribune Media +6% as Apollo reportedly teams up on bid (Nov. 28 2018)
    • Previously: Report: ION Media, Cerberus, Hicks team on Tribune bid (Nov. 13 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • BRQS

    Microcaps dominate midday movers

    • Gainers: Borqs Technologies (NASDAQ:BRQS) +173%. Tel-Instrument Electronics (NYSEMKT:TIK) +68%. Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) +41%. Oragenics (NYSEMKT:OGEN) +26%. Arsanis (NASDAQ:ASNS) +23%. EQGP Holdings (NYSE:EQGP) +18%. Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) +18%. Universal Technical Institute (NYSE:UTI) +18%. Workday (NYSE:WDAY) +13%. TRACON Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:TCON) +13%.
    • Losers: China Ceramics (NASDAQ:CCCL) -25%. Tonix Pharmaceuticals Holding (NASDAQ:TNXP) -22%. Vivint Solar (NYSE:VSLR) -22%. Yext (NYSE:YEXT) -17%. Callaway Golf Company (NYSE:ELY) -15%. AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) -15%. Sprouts Farmers Market (NASDAQ:SFM) -14%. Genprex (NASDAQ:GNPX) -12%. OptiNose (NASDAQ:OPTN) -12%. PagSeguro Digital (NYSE:PAGS) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • SHPG

    Takeda may sell up to $10B in assets to help fund Shire deal

    • In an interview, Takeda Pharmaceutical Company (TKPYY +1.6%) CFO Costa Saroukos said that the company could sell up to $10B in non-core assets to help finance its $62B takeout of Shire plc (SHPG +1.9%), twice the amount reported previously.
    • Potential assets on the block are Shire's SHP647 for IBD and certain Takeda OTC products in Europe.
    • 2/3 of Takeda shareholders still have to bless the merger. They will vote at a special meeting on December 5.
    • Previously: Former Takeda chief not on board with Shire deal (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 6 Comments
  • DAL

    Airline stocks extend on recent gains

    • Airline stocks are solidly higher after Morgan Stanley says traffic trends are positive for November and oil prices trickle down again.
    • "Unit costs (ex-fuel) are being managed well, despite inflationary pressures, while oil continues to fall ... The net of these will support consensus EPS, even beyond our above-street forecasts," reads today's MS note (per Bloomberg).
    • Notable gainers include Delta Air Lines (DAL +2.8%), Spirit Airlines (SAVE +2.3%), American Airlines Group (AAL +2.1%), Allegiant Travel (ALGT +3.8%) and SkyWest (SKYW +2.2%).
    • Related ETF: JETS.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 5 Comments
  • CXDC

    China XD Plastics Company leads consumer gainers and Callaway Golf Company leads losers

    • Gainers: China XD Plastics Company (NASDAQ:CXDC) +12%. BRP (OTC:BRPIF) +9%. G-III Apparel Group (NASDAQ:GIII) +6%.
    • Losers: Callaway Golf Company (NYSE:ELY) -16%. Pingtan Marine Enterprise (NASDAQ:PME) -6%. Funko (NASDAQ:FNKO) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • LH

    Piper defends LabCorp after guidance cut; shares down 11%

    • LabCorp (LH -11.3%) is down on more than double normal volume after trimming its 2018 outlook earlier today.
    • Piper Jaffray's William Quirk (OVERWEIGHT/$180) says the softness is a short-term issue and represents an attractive buying opportunity for long-term investors citing the expected rebound in its consumer business.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 10 Comments
  • SC

    Santander Consumer USA's slide provides buying opportunity: Piper

    • Recent weakness in Santander Consumer USA (SC -2.8%) provides a longer-term buying opportunity, Piper's Kevin Barker writes.
    • The stock may be declining after Asset-Backed Alert reports that Fiat Chrysler  (FCAU -1.8%) is considering a deal to buy subprime lender Exeter Finance, Barker wrote.
    • Says SC would be "massively over-capitalized" with CET1 over 24% on Chrysler Capital break-up and profit margins would widen as SC refocuses on core subprime customer base.
    • Could motivate parent Banco Santander to buy the rest of SC's public shares outstanding.
    • Previously: More on Santander Consumer USA Q3: Total auto originations rise 52% Y/Y (Oct. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 7 Comments
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources -3% as Oppenheimer downgrades on acquisition doubts

    • Denbury Resources (DNR -2.8%) slides after Oppenheimer downgrades shares to Perform from Outperform and removes its $9 price target, saying uncertainty around the proposed acquisition of Penn Virginia (PVAC -2%) likely will keep DNR shares range-bound.
    • Oppenheimer analyst Tim Rezvan says he lacks confidence that DNR will get enough votes to close the acquisition and sees an increased risk of "strategic limbo" should the deal fall through.
    • Earlier this week, Mangrove Partners raised its active stake ion PVAC to 10.7%, saying it would vote against the merger and file its own proxy statement to solicit votes against the proposed deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 23 Comments
  • BKD

    Brookdale Senior Living up 2% on plan from activist investor

    • Brookdale Senior Living (BKD +1.8%) perks up on average volume in apparent response to a new plan from activist investor Jonathan Litt for restructuring the company.
    • Mr. Litt, founder of Land and Buildings Investment Management, LLC, has been agitating for change in the company for some time.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • TSLA

    Elon Musk cracks the whip on Model 3 production, margins

    • Tesla (TSLA +2.7%) hit a goal of producing 1K Model 3s in a single day, according to an update from Electrek.
    • Although a bit of a milestone, hitting the target isn't causing Elon Musk to take his foot off the accelerator. In an email to employees, Musk said maintaining a high production level should be the top priority of all employees.
    • Clearly, Musk is also thinking about margins. "It’s important to bear in mind that the cost of the car is made up of about 10,000 unique parts and processes. depending on how you count it, the current cost of a standard range Model 3 would be around $38,000, so each part or process step only costs around $3.80. That means finding cost efficiencies is a game of pennies, even though it might not seem so," Musk told employees.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 476 Comments
  • AQST

    Aquestive continues post-CRL selloff, shares down 6%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Aquestive Therapeutics (AQST -5.9%) is down again, albeit on below-average volume. Shares have lost over half their value since the company announced the receipt of a CRL from the FDA regarding its marketing application for tadalafil oral film.
    • Previously: FDA rejects Aquestive's marketing application for tadalafil oral film (Nov. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • CASI

    CASI Pharma up 15%

    • Thinly traded micro cap CASI Pharmaceuticals (CASI +15.1%) clears brief consolidation on average volume. Shares have rallied 60% in a month.
    • In late October, it acquired Laurus Labs' U.S. marketing authorization (ANDA) for its generic version of tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) for the treatment of hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection for $700K upfront and up to $2.3M in milestones. It plans to commercialize the product in China.
    • Yesterday after the close, the SEC declared its prospectus for the resale of up to ~9.1M common shares from existing investors effective.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharm continues post-Firdapse approval selloff, shares down 13%

    • Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (CPRX -12.8%) is down again, on 80% higher volume. Shares have sold off 21% since the FDA nod for Firdapse (amifampridine) for LEMS.
    • Investors appear concerned that there may be pricing headwinds due to the low cost of compounded alternatives and a persistent political environment sensitive to high-priced meds, especially repurposed ones like Firdapse.
    • Sell-side cheerleaders are undeterred. Oppenheimer, Cantor Fitzgerald and H.C. Wainwright all maintain their Buy ratings with price targets of $6 - 8.
    • Previously: Uninsured LEMS sufferers could face profoundly higher med cost if switched to Catalyst Pharma's Firdapse (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 39 Comments
  • ADIL

    Adial Pharmaceuticals and Oragenics among Healthcare gainers; Tonix Pharmaceuticals and Catalyst Pharmaceuticals among losers

    • Gainers: Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) +68%. Oragenics (NYSEMKT:OGEN) +16%. Arsanis (NASDAQ:ASNS) +13%. CASI Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CASI) +10%. Fate Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FATE) +10%.
    • Losers: Tonix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:TNXP) -21%. Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CPRX) -13%. Laboratory Corporation of America  (NYSE:LH) -11%. Alliqua BioMedical (NASDAQ:ALQA) -9%. Aquestive Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AQST) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • CHRS

    Coherus' Neulasta biosimilar included in federal drug program for the poor; shares up 2%

    • Coherus BioSciences (CHRS +1.9%) inks a contract with HRSA-designated Prime Vendor Apexus, LLC for its 304B drug pricing program that includes Neulasta biosimilar UDENYCA (pegfilgrastim-cbqv).
    • The company says the 340B channel, a federal program under which drug makers provide discounts for medications used in outpatient settings for the poor, accounts for 35% of Neulasta unit sales in the U.S.
    • It also announces the establishment of a reimbursement code for the product that will take effect on January 1, 2019, when commercial launch begins.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    Chipotle largest decliner in restaurant sector

    • Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) is down 3.75% in morning trading without any huge catalysts standing out.
    • The share price decline today for Chipotle is the largest of the 52 publicly-traded stocks in the restaurant sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 2 Comments
  • COUP

    Loop steps to Buy on Coupa

    • Loop Capital upgrades Coupa Software (NASDAQ:COUP) from Hold to Buy with a $72 price target.
    • Coupa will report Q3 results on December 3. Analysts expect a loss per share of $0.03 and revenue of 62.59M.
    • Coupa shares are up 3.5% to $64.84.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • OGEN

    Oragenics up 23%

    • Nano cap Oragenics (OGEN +22.8%) is up on over 50% higher volume in early trade. Shares have rallied 55% since Wednesday.
    • On Tuesday, it announced the publication of a research paper about expanding the "drugability" of the lantibiotic Mutacin 1140 (MU1140). The company's pipeline candidate OG716 is a second-generation variant of MU1140.
    • On the working capital front, at the end of September it had $13.8M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed $6.1M across the first three quarters.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • PANW

    Gabelli steps off Palo Alto sidelines after earnings

    • Gabelli upgrades Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) from Hold to Buy after yesterday's earnings report.
    • Analyst Hendi Susanto cites the current valuation and says the firm believes Palo Alto "can continue to deliver outstanding strong sales growth, win market share and expand its operating profitability."
    • Palo Alto shares are up 1.3% to $178.36.
    • Previously: Palo Alto +2% on Q1 beats, upside guidance (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 5 Comments
  • MAR

    Massive Marriott data breach digested by investors

    • Marriott International (NYSE:MAR) is down 5.0% as investors digest the massive data breach disclosed by the company earlier today.
    • Wasting no time, the New York Attorney General has already opened an investigation into Marriott. However, Jefferies is out with a note that reminds of the "marginal" impact to EPS from data breaches in general (per Bloomberg).
    • Previously: Marriott -5.6% as Starwood database breached (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 5 Comments
  • SENR

    Strategic Environmental & Energy Resources slides 10% post Q3 results

    • Strategic Environmental (OTCQB:SENR) reports Q3 revenue growth of 6.3% Y/Y to $1.7M.
    • Industrial Cleaning revenue was $0.8M (+100% Y/Y); Environmental Solutions revenue totaled $0.8M (+14.3% Y/Y) & Solid Waste net revenue was $94K (-81.2% Y/Y).
    • Gross profit margin increased 130 bps to 12%, the increase was due to increased attention to pricing and aggressive cost management.
    • Q3 adj. EBITDA loss was $0.5M compared to income of $2M Y/Y.
    • Cash for Q3 totaled $38K (-62% Y/Y) & net cash used in operations totaled $1.1M (-50% Y/Y).
    • Previously: Strategic Environmental reports Q3 results (Nov. 15 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • SNE

    Sony +1.4% as Citigroup sees 52% upside, raises to Buy

    • Sony (NYSE:SNE) is up 1.4% in premarket NYSE trading with Citigroup boosting its rating to Buy.
    • That's based largely on a structural shift away from "electronics heavyweight" toward a content/platform company, a move that the market has noticed, analyst Kota Ezawa writes, but has failed to give the proper valuation.
    • The firm raised its price target to ¥9,000 from ¥6,000 (implying 52% upside), and expects enterprise value to rise overall to ¥10T (about $88.1B).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 7 Comments
  • WWE

    WWE +2.7% as JPMorgan sees value even after 136% gain

    • World Wrestling Entertainment (NYSE:WWE) is up 2.7% premarket with JPMorgan still seeing upside after a 2018 that's seen a 136% gain in the stock.
    • Despite that healthy gain, shares have pulled back 16.5% this quarter, and JPMorgan has upraded to Overweight from Neutral.
    • The company's opportunity set is "compelling" long term with domestic content still "significantly underpriced relative to traditional sports, while abroad it is moving to better monetize the viewership of its video content," the firm says. Worries about live attendance and product sales are "overstated," and those will get a boost as SmackDown moves to Fox broadcast in the coming year's deal. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • The firm raised its price target to $87 from $84, implying 21% further upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • CCCL

    CCL, PAGS and YEXT among premarket losers

    • China Ceramics (NASDAQ:CCCL) -24% on announcing $1.27M public offering.

  • Dow futures pare loss after Lighthizer says he sees Trump-Xi dinner `success'

    • U.S. stock market futures pare losses after U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said he anticipates the widely-watched dinner between President Donald Trump and China's Xi Jinping to be a "success."
    • Dow Jones Industrial Average futures' decline pares to 0.3% vs. 0.5% drop earlier.
    • S&P 500 futures now -0.3%, vs 0.5%; Nasdaq improves to -0.2% from -0.5% earlier.
    • Trump and Xi are expected to discuss trade issues at the dinner at the G-20 summit in Argentina; on Thursday the Wall Street Journal reported the two countries are exploring suspending further tariffs with the hopes of opening a new round of talks that could lead to a truce.
    • Meanwhile, U.S. 2-year Treasury note falls, pushing its yield up 1.6 basis points to 2.82%, while the 10-year Treasury edges up, pushing its yield down 1 bp to 3.018%.

  • GE

    GE price target cut to $7 at Deutsche; shares down 5%

    • General Electric's (NYSE:GE) stock price target is cut to $7 from $11 at Deutsche Bank, saying revenue for the company's struggling power business "remains flattish but does not continue to decline."
    • "We think the key debates can be boiled down to the trajectory of GE Industrial [free cash flow] and whether the company is headed for a liquidity crisis," says Deutsche Bank analyst Nicole DeBlase, adding that the firm's base case assumes "an economic downturn does not happen" through the end of 2021.
    • DeBase sees "execution mishaps" from CEO Larry Culp's strategy review as a key risk moving forward, as well as outside factors such as an economic downturn or geopolitical instability.
    • In Deutsche Bank's base case scenario, GE would see ~$0.34/share of free cash flow in 2019 and $0.25/share in 2020.
    • DeBlase says the firm will "ignore the bull case for now since it probably wouldn't be viewed as credible," but even in a bear case, the firm does not foresee a liquidity crisis and continues to rate the stock as a Hold.
    • GE -2.5% pre-market.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 139 Comments

  • GE

    WSJ: In GE probe, ex-staffers say insurance risks were ignored

    • General Electric (NYSE:GE) -2.3% pre-market after WSJ reports former employees have told SEC investigators that certain insurance risks were ignored, leading the company to have less-than-sufficient reserves to cover losses.
    • GE's insurance business failed to internally acknowledge worsening results over the years, according to several ex-staffers who say they have been interviewed by government lawyers; in the article, the people describe examples of what they consider lax managerial oversight and buried risks that ultimately kept the company from booking bigger reserves.
    • GE has said the SEC probe started after the company earlier this year disclosed that a shortfall in those reserves for long-term-care policies would require more than $15B in funding.

  • Futures wobble as leaders gather at G20 summit

    • Shares across Europe and U.S. futures are drifting lower on the final day of November, as markets watch ongoing trade developments between the world's two largest economies.
    • President Trump and China's Xi Jinping are expected to meet on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Argentina and the two leaders will have a dinner meeting with staff on Saturday evening.
    • The presence of three top crude producers - Saudi Arabia, Russia and the U.S. - have also raised expectations that oil policy will be discussed in Buenos Aires.
